resource.name: Berkeley PD Log - Jail Bookings
resource.description: Adults booked into the Berkeley Police Department Jail over the past 30 days.
columns_description:
FOR MORE INFO SEE THE .PDF ATTACHMENT UNDER THE ABOUT TAB.  The Disposition describes how the detainee left the custody of the Berkeley Police Department Jail.  The following is a legend for disposition codes:

(849(b) PC-RELEASE)	No prosecution requested	
(BAILED)		Released pursuant to bail bond
(CITE-JAIL)		Cited at Jail, then Released
(CITE-MEDICAL)		Cited at Jail, enroute medical
(COURT BOOKING)		Court ordered booking, released
(ENROUTE)		Enroute to other agency	
(HAYWARD COURT)	Moved to Hayward Courthouse
(MEDICAL)		Medical	release
(NO COMPLAINT	)	No complaint sought
(NORTH COUNTY JAIL)	Moved to Glenn Dyer Detention Facility
(SANTA RITA JAIL)		Moved to Santa Rita County Jail
(SANTA RITA-MEDICAL)	Enroute to Santa Rita Jail via 			medical evaluation
The name of the person booked
Date and time of the booking

The Booking Number is a sequential index number that identifies one booking from another. The first four numbers of the Booking Number designate the year, followed by a
hyphen and then a sequential number generated by the
police Records Management System (RMS).

FOR MORE INFO SEE THE .PDF ATTACHMENT UNDER THE ABOUT TAB. This field contains the booking agency’s Originating Reporting Identifier (ORI).  Every law enforcement agency is assigned a unique ORI for identification purposes.  

The following are the ORI’s of common agencies that transport bookings to the Berkeley City Jail:

(CA0010000)	Alameda County Sheriff's Office
(CA0010200)	Albany Police Department
(CA0010300)	Berkeley Police Department
(CA0010400)	Emeryville Police Department
(CA0012100)	BART Police Department
(CA0019700)	UC Berkeley Police Department
(CA0019970)	CHP - Golden Gate
(CA0073700)	Dept. of Alcoholic Beverage Control
(CA034085G)	Division of Adult Parole Operations

Any agency not listed above is identified as “OTHER”.
FOR MORE INFO SEE THE .PDF ATTACHMENT UNDER THE ABOUT TAB. The Case Number identifies the police report documenting the arrest

The statutory code the statute number is found in. The following are common Statute Types:  (BMC)	Berkeley Municipal Code, (BP) Business and Professional Code, (EC) Education Code, (GC) Government Code, (HN) 	Harbors and Navigations Code, (HS) Health and Safety Code, (PC) Penal Code, (VC) Vehicle Code, (WI)	Welfare and Institutions Code
The statutory number section of the violation
The date of birth of the person booked
A plain text summary description of the statute.  Expand the column to see the complete description.
The sex of the person booked
The race of the person booked

resource.name: Business Licenses
resource.description: Registered businesses in the City of Berkeley with business license records
columns_description: APN is the acronym for “Assessor’s Parcel Number”. Note, “Z”s in this field represent a business that is not physically located in the City of Berkeley.
Indicates whether business is minority owned
Indicates whether business is female owned
Detailed description of type of work performed
DBA is the acronym for “Doing Business As” the commonly known business name.

The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) is the standard used by Federal statistical agencies in classifying business establishments for the purpose of collecting, analyzing, and publishing statistical data related to the U.S. business economy.
Further information can be found at the US Census Bureau http://www.census.gov/eos/www/naics/.

A new Business License application must reflect an accurate classification of the business activity, and your annual BLT renewal payment is based on the corresponding rate (based on gross receipts, rents, or other business-specific income). Current list of classifications and tax rates is listed here: http://www.ci.berkeley.ca.us/Finance/Home/Business_Licenses__Classifications___Tax_Rates.aspx.
Type of business ownership structure (i.e. corporation, LLC, sole ownership, etc)
Business Contact Type (i.e. owner, co-owner, etc)
Business Physical Street Address of Business in Berkeley (if 0 Various then business is located elsewhere but operates in Berkeley without a physical location, i.e. contractor, etc).
Business Physical City "BERKELEY", used for mapping
Business Physical State "CA", used for mapping
Location of Business in Berkeley (if 0 Various then business is located elsewhere but operates in Berkeley without a physical location, i.e. contractor, etc).

resource.name: Berkeley PD - Stop Data
resource.description:
This data was extracted from the Department’s Public Safety Server and covers the data beginning January 26, 2015.  On January 26, 2015 the department began collecting data pursuant to General Order B-4 (issued December 31, 2014).  Under that order, officers were required to provide certain data after making all vehicle detentions (including bicycles) and pedestrian detentions (up to five persons).  This data set lists stops by police in the categories of traffic, suspicious vehicle, pedestrian and bicycle stops.  Incident number, date and time, location and disposition codes are also listed in this data.

Address data has been changed from a specific address, where applicable, and listed as the block where the incident occurred.  Disposition codes were entered by officers who made the stop.  These codes included the person(s) race, gender, age (range), reason for the stop, enforcement action taken, and whether or not a search was conducted.

The officers of the Berkeley Police Department are prohibited from biased based policing, which is defined as any police-initiated action that relies on the race, ethnicity, or national origin rather than the behavior of an individual or information that leads the police to a particular individual who has been identified as being engaged in criminal activity.
columns_description: General longitude of the call.  This data is only uploaded after January 2017.
General latitude of the call.  This data is only uploaded after January 2017

Ordered in the following sequence:
1st Character = Race, as follows:
A (Asian) B (Black) H (Hispanic) O (Other) W (White)
2nd Character = Gender, as follows:
F (Female) M (Male)
3rd Character = Age Range, as follows:
1 (Less than 18) 2 (18-29) 3 (30-39), 4 (Greater than 40)
4th Character = Reason, as follows:
I (Investigation) T (Traffic) R (Reasonable Suspicion)
K (Probation/Parole) W (Wanted)
5th Character = Enforcement, as follows:
A (Arrest) C (Citation) O (Other) W (Warning)
6th Character = Car Search, as follows:
S (Search) N (No Search)

Additional dispositions may also appear.  They are:
P - Primary case report
M - MDT narrative only
AR - Arrest report only (no case report submitted)
IN - Incident report
FC - Field Card
CO - Collision investigation report
MH - Emergency Psychiatric Evaluation
TOW - Impounded vehicle
0 or 00000 – Officer made a stop of more than five persons
This is the occurred incident type created in the CAD program.  A code signifies a traffic stop (T), suspicious vehicle stop (1196), pedestrian stop (1194) and bicycle stop (1194B).
Date and time of the incident/stop
Number of incident created by Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD) program

domain_metadata.value: This data was extracted from the Department’s Public Safety Server and covers the dates from January 26, 2015 through the most present upload of data.  On January 26, 2015 the department began collecting data pursuant to General Order B-4 (issued December 31, 2014).  Under that order, officers were required to provide certain data after making all vehicle detentions (including bicycles) and pedestrian detentions (up to five persons).  This data set lists stops by police in the categories of traffic, suspicious vehicle, pedestrian and bicycle stops.  Incident number, date and time, location and disposition codes are also listed in this data.  Address data has been changed from a specific address, where applicable, and listed as the block where the incident occurred.  Disposition codes were entered by officers who made the stop.  These codes included the person(s) race, gender, age (range), reason for the stop, enforcement action taken, and whether or not a search was conducted.  The officers of the Berkeley Police Department are prohibited from biased based policing, which is defined as any police-initiated action that relies on the race, ethnicity, or national origin rather than the behavior of an individual or information that leads the police to a particular individual who has been identified as being engaged in criminal activity.

resource.name: Restaurant Inspections Map
resource.description: This data set contains inspection information for approximately 800 food facilities permitted in the City of Berkeley. These include restaurants, bars, grocery stores, markets and any facility that dispenses food to the public. This information includes name and address of the food facility, identification of any major or minor violations, and date of last inspection. Data is updated once a week.
resource.attribution: City of Berkeley - Environmental Health Division
columns_description: Date & time data was pulled from database

resource.description: This data set contains inspection information for approximately 800 food facilities permitted in the City of Berkeley. columns_description: An organizational unit comprised of divisions or programs. It is possible for a department to be comprised of only one division.
A twelve-month period of time to which the budget applies.   For the City of Berkeley, this period is from July 1 through June 30.

A independent fiscal and accounting entity with a self-balancing set of accounts recording cash and/or other resources, together with all related liabilities, obligations, reserves and equities which are segregated for the purpose of carrying on specific activities or attaining certain objectives in accordance with special regulations.

resource.name: City of Berkeley Salaries - 2011, 2012 and 2013
resource.description: Berkeley payroll data as reported on Transparent California,  http://transparentcalifornia.com .
columns_description: The "Total pay & benefits" column underreports the total compensation of government employees whose government employer did not provided complete salary or benefit information.
The "Other pay" category includes the compensation in the numerous other pay categories some public employees receive.

"Total benefits" only includes benefits directly received by the employee: medical insurance (health, dental, and vision) and employer-paid retirement contributions. The total cost of the employee will be higher than the values reported here as there are associated costs (such as workman's comp, state unemployment insurance, medicare/SS costs, etc) that we do not report as employee compensation.
The “Overtime pay” column includes overtime compensation as the reporting agency classifies it.

resource.name: BESO Time of Sale Property Status
resource.description: This list contains the compliance status of properties subject to the BESO time of sale requirement. If your building is not listed then it is required to comply with BESO at time of sale. If the status for your property is incorrect, email BESO@CityofBerkeley.info. For more information about the time of sale requirement please visit: www.cityofberkeley.info/besosale/
columns_description: Date the energy assessment is due if it has been deferred.
This is the simplified status for the time of sale requirement.
If the status description is Deferred to Buyer (Form C) or Deferred (Form D) than an assessment is required to be submitted by the energy report due date.
Buildings are grouped by the following property types: House 1-4 Units, Multifamily 5+ Units, Commercial, Mixed Use, Industrial, and Other

domain_metadata.value: Energy use in our homes and commercial buildings is the second leading contributor of greenhouse gases in the City of Berkeley making up almost 40% of our overall greenhouse gas emissions, according to 2016 available data.  BESO requires building owners and homeowners to complete and publicly report comprehensive energy assessments to uncover energy saving opportunities. The assessments are conducted by registered energy assessors who provide tailored recommendations on how to save energy and link building owners to incentive programs for energy efficiency upgrades. Energy efficiency improvements are voluntary and encouraged. BESO is required prior to sale of a house or whole building under 25,000 square feet. This dataset contains the status of properties compliant or non-compliant with the BESO time of sale requirement. Properties are listed once an application has been submitted. Building owners can look-up and verify their building’s status on the open data portal for the BESO requirement.

resource.name: Energy PGE Metered Energy
resource.description: All energy metered by PG&E. Does not include electrical power delivered to LBL through their own substation.
columns_description: Sum of Electricity (MMBtu) and Natural Gas (MMBtu)

Electricity consumption in millions of British thermal units,
converted at 3,412 Btus per kWh

Natural gas consumption in millions of British thermal units,
converted at 100,000 Btus per therm

domain_metadata.value: All energy metered by PG&E. Does not include electrical power delivered to LBL through their own substation.  Includes natural gas for cogenerator on UCB campus.  Electrical generation from the cogenerator is fed directly into the grid. PG&E cannot generate data for 1993 - 1998 or for 2001-2004.  Includes wholesale (direct access and non-core gas) power as well.  Conversion to million Btu (MMBtu) of energy delivered to the site = (kWh *3412.3)/1,000,000 and (therms*100,000)/1,000,000.

resource.name: California State Controller - Government Financial Reports
resource.description: The California State Controller's Office site for Government Financial Reports.

domain_metadata.value: State Controller John Chiang has posted more than 13 million fields of financial information, provided by California’s 58 counties and more than 450 cities over the past 11 years, in an open data format. In addition to providing basic statistics about each city and county, this website details their revenues, expenditures, liabilities, assets, and fund balances.

resource.name: BESO Large Building Energy Data and Compliance Status
resource.description: This dataset contains the compliance status and reported energy metrics of large buildings (greater than 25,000 square feet) subject to BESO's energy benchmarking and assessment requirement. If the status for your property is incorrect, email BESO@CityofBerkeley.info. For more information about the requirements for large buildings, please visit: www.cityofberkeley.info/BESO
columns_description: Buildings are grouped into the following property types: Commercial, Multifamily 5+ Units, Industrial, Mixed Use, and Other

The ENERGY STAR score provides a comprehensive snapshot of your building's energy performance. It assesses the building's physical assets, operations, and occupant behavior in a quick and easy-to-understand number between 1-100.
Site EUI is the total energy use consumed on site per square foot.
Source EUI is the energy use consumed on site plus all the delivery and production losses per square foot.

The ENERGY STAR score provides a comprehensive snapshot of your building's energy performance. It assesses the building's physical assets, operations, and occupant behavior in a quick and easy-to-understand number between 1-100.
Site EUI is the total energy use consumed on site per square foot.
Source EUI is the energy use consumed on site plus all the delivery and production losses per square foot.

domain_metadata.value: Energy use in our homes and commercial buildings is the second leading contributor of greenhouse gases in the City of Berkeley making up almost 40% of our overall greenhouse gas emissions, according to 2016 available data.  BESO requires buildings greater than 25,000 square feet to complete and publicly report comprehensive energy assessments to uncover energy saving opportunities as well as disclose their energy use annually. The assessments are conducted by registered energy assessors who provide tailored recommendations on how to save energy and link building owners to incentive programs for energy efficiency upgrades. Energy efficiency improvements are voluntary and encouraged. This dataset contains the status of properties compliant or non-compliant with the BESO requirements for large buildings as well as the energy use data disclosed through their annual reporting. Currently, this dataset is uploaded to Berkeley’s website as a searchable PDF. Building owners can now look-up and verify their building’s status on the open data portal for each BESO requirement. Additionally, Berkeley can now use the annual energy use data in this dataset to publically disclose a building’s energy performance over time and compare it’s energy use to other buildings of the same use type and square footage.
